page.title: 07THE RIVER AVON.
page.content: { The River Avon}flows through {Netheravon and Figheldean.}It is a chalk stream and the Head Water Keeper is responsible for keeping it stocked.The fishes' eggs are taken from the river and hatched in an incubator. After seventy days they hatch and live on the yolk sac for three weeks. At the end of three years when they are about eleven inches long, they are returned to the river. The main predators are the pike, the kingfisher and the heron. Poachers can also be a problem. There are 90 members in the fishing syndicate on this stretch of the Avon. The largest number of trout caught in one season was 2100 in 1955. The longest fish caught was a pike which was 42 inches long and weighed 20lbs.
